column1: Table D1.13.10: Select variables contributing to community functioning for Indigenous Australians aged 15 and over(a), by sex, Australia 2014–15(b)
Connectedness to country, land and history; culture and identity
Recognises homelands
Speaks an Aboriginal/Torres Strait Islander language
Attended Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultural event in last 12 months
Identifies with clan group or language group
Feels able to have a say with family and friends some, most or all of the time
Contact with family or friends outside household at least once per week
Has friends can confide in(c)
Able to get support in time of crisis from outside household—from family
Provides support to relatives outside household
Resilience
Did not feel treated unfairly because Aboriginal/Torres Strait Islander in last 12 months
Did not avoid situations due to past unfair treatment in the last 12 months
Can visit homelands
Involvement with Aboriginal/Torres Strait Islander organisation
Work allows for cultural responsibilities—can meet responsibilities(d)
Used strategies to meet living expenses(e)
No community problems reported
No problems reported for alcohol
No problems reported for illicit drugs
No problems reported for family violence
No problems reported for sexual assault
Agrees that most people can be trusted
Agrees that their doctor can be trusted
Agrees that the hospital can be trusted
Agrees that police in the local area can be trusted
Agrees that police outside the local area can be trusted
Agrees that the local school can be trusted
Adult participated in sport/social/community activities in last 12 months
Having a role, structure and routine
In the last 12 months, has lived in only one dwelling(f)
Feeling safe
Felt safe at home alone after dark
Felt safe walking alone in local area after dark
Not a victim of physical or threatened violence in the last 12 months
Was taught Indigenous culture at school or as part of further studies
Learnt about own Indigenous clan/language
Vitality
Self-assessed health status excellent or very good
Has no disability or long term-health condition
Low/moderate level of psychological distress (5–11 K5 score)
Living in a dwelling that has no major structural problems
Accessed Internet in last 12 months
Has access to motor vehicles whenever needed
Can easily get to places needed
Total persons aged 15 and over

(a) Unless otherwise indicated, proportions are of the estimated total Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander population aged 15 and over. Where another population is indicated, this has been used to calculate proportions.
(b) Cells in this table have been randomly adjusted to avoid the release of confidential data.  Discrepancies may occur between sums of the component items and totals.
(c) Including family.
(d) Proportions calculated in relation to number of Indigenous Australians aged 15 and over who are employed.

(e) Selected strategies include short term loans, pawned or sold something, did not have meals, sought assistance from welfare/community organisations or family or friends, ran up a tab at local store, and  gave someone else access to keycard.
(f) Persons who have lived in their current dwelling for more than 12 months.
Source: AIHW and ABS analysis of National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Social Survey 2014–15.
